message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this amazing product! It's a one-of-a-kind item that I think you'll really love. I'm willing to let it go for $120.
I'm really interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $100.
I appreciate your interest in the product, Bob. However, I'm afraid I need to make a profit, so I can't go as low as $100. I'm willing to meet you halfway at $110. What do you think?
I'm still a bit hesitant about the price. I was thinking more along the lines of $105. Can you meet me there?
I can see you're really interested in the product, Bob! I'm willing to compromise, but I need to make a decent profit. I can meet you at $108, but that's as low as I can go. What do you think?
I'm still not sure I can go that high. I was thinking more along the lines of $105 again. Can you reconsider?

I've already met you at $105 in a previous offer, Bob. I'm not willing to go back to that price. I'm willing to make one more concession, so I'll meet you at $110, but that's my final offer. Take it or leave it.
I'm not willing to go back to $110. I'm still thinking $105 is a fair price. Can you meet me there?

I'm starting to think we're not going to come to an agreement at this price, Bob. I'm willing to make one last concession, but I need to make a profit. I can offer you a deal for $115, but that's as low as I can go. If you're not willing to meet me there, I'll have to consider other options.
I'm really not comfortable with $115. I was thinking more along the lines of $108, but I'm willing to meet you halfway at $111.5. Can you consider that?
